get.description:
Get files in a directory.

Args:
    path (str): Path to the directory.
Returns:
    FolderInfo|None: Folder information or None if folder doesn't exist. 

Raises:
    HTTPException (404): If the folder is not found.

schema.title: Response Get Files Api V1 Files Files Get

get.description:
Stream video files.

Args:
    file_path (str): Path to the video file.
    range (str, optional=None): Range of bytes to stream. 

Raises:
    HTTPException (400): If the file path is invalid.
    HTTPException (404): If the file is not found.
    HTTPException (400): If the file is not a video file. 

Returns:
    Response: Video stream response.
Read the contents of a file.

schema.title: Response Read File Api V1 Files Read Get

get.description: Get information about the video file.

delete.description: Delete a file/folder from the filesystem.

schema.title: Response Delete File Fol Api V1 Files Delete Delete

get.description:
Get all media from the database. 

Optionally apply filters and sorting. 

Args:
    movies_only (bool, Optional=None):
        Flag to get only movies.
        - If `True`, it will return only `movies`.
        - If `False`, it will return only `series`.
        - If `None`, it will return all media items. 

    filter_by (str, Optional=`all`):
        Filter the media items by a column value. Available filters are
        - `all`
        - `downloaded`
        - `monitored`
        - `missing`
        - `unmonitored`. 

    sort_by (str, Optional=None): Sort the media items by `title`, `year`,             `added_at`, or `updated_at`. 

    sort_asc (bool, Optional=True): Flag to sort in ascending order. 

Returns:
    list[MediaRead]: List of media objects.

schema.title: Response Get All Media Api V1 Media All Get

get.description:
Get recent media from the database. 

Args:
    limit (int, Optional=30): Number of items to return.
    offset (int, Optional=0): Number of items to skip.
    movies_only (bool, Optional=None):
        Flag to get only movies.
        - If `True`, it will return only `movies`.
        - If `False`, it will return only `series`.
        - If `None`, it will return all media items. 

Returns:
- list[MediaRead]: List of media objects.

schema.title: Response Get Recent Media Api V1 Media  Get

get.description:
Get media updated after a certain datetime. 

Args:
    seconds (int): Seconds since epoch to filter media.
Returns:
    list[MediaRead]: List of media objects.

schema.title: Response Get Updated After Api V1 Media Updated Get

get.description:
Get recently downloaded media from the database. 

Args:
    limit (int, Optional=30): Number of items to return.
    offset (int, Optional=0): Number of items to skip. 

Returns:
    list[MediaRead]: List of media objects.

schema.title: Response Get Recently Downloaded Api V1 Media Downloaded Get

get.description:

Returns:
    list[SearchMedia]: List of search media objects.

post.description:
Download trailer for media by ID. 

Args:
    media_id (int): ID of the media item.
    profile_id (int): ID of the trailer profile to use for downloading.
    yt_id (str, Optional=""): YouTube ID of the trailer.

Returns:
    str: Downloading trailer message.

Monitor media by ID. 

Args:

Returns:

Update YouTube ID for media by ID.

Returns:

Search for trailer for media by ID.

Returns:

delete.description:
Delete trailer for media by ID. 

Args:
    media_id (int): ID of the media item. 

Returns:

schema.title: Response Delete Media Trailer Api V1 Media  Media Id  Trailer Delete

post.description:
Batch update media by their IDs. 

Available update types are: 

- monitor: Monitor media items. 

- unmonitor: Unmonitor media items. 

- delete: Delete media items. 

- download: Download trailers for media items. 

Args:
    update (BulkUpdate): Bulk update object with media ids and update type.
Returns:
    str: Monitoring message.

ConnectionCreate.title: ConnectionCreate
ConnectionCreate.description: Connection model for creating a new connection. This is used in the API while creating.

ConnectionRead.title: ConnectionRead
ConnectionRead.description: Connection model for reading a connection. This is used in the API to return data.

ConnectionUpdate.title: ConnectionUpdate
ConnectionUpdate.description: Connection model for updating a connection. This is used in the API while updating.

size.title: Size
size.description: Size of the file/folder in human-readable format (e.g. '10 KB').

files.title: Files
files.description: List of FileInfo or FolderInfo objects representing files and folders         inside a given folder.

created.title: Created
created.description: Creation time of the folder in 'YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS' format.

FolderInfo.title: FolderInfo
FolderInfo.description:
Contains information about files and (sub)folders in a given folder. 

Attrs:
    - type (str): Type of the entry (folder).
    - name (str): Name of the folder.
    - files (list[FileInfo | FolderInfo]): List of FileInfo or FolderInfo
        objects representing files and folders inside a given folder.
    - created (str): Creation time of the folder in "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS"
        format.

PathMappingCRU.title: PathMappingCRU
PathMappingCRU.description: Path Mapping model to use for Create, Read, and Update operations.
